verses.roman:
'nityānanda' balite haya kṛṣṇa-premodaya
āulāya sakala aṅga, aśru-gaṅgā vaya

synonyms: nityānanda balite—while talking of Nityānanda Prabhu; haya—it so becomes; kṛṣṇa-prema-udaya—awakening of love of Kṛṣṇa; āulāya—agitated; sakala—all; aṅga—limbs of the body; aśru-gaṅgā—tears like the Ganges waters; vaya—flow down.
translation: Simply by talking of Nityānanda Prabhu one awakens his love for Kṛṣṇa. Thus all his bodily limbs are agitated by ecstasy, and tears flow from his eyes like the waters of the Ganges.
